message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.GT, cs.MM, cs.HC

The paper deals with deep learning solutions for capturing and rendering novel views of real-world scenes, which is a common problem in computer vision and graphics. The use of multiplane image (MPI) scene representation and plenoptic sampling theory suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) and graphics (cs.GR) sub-categories. The practical application of the approach in an augmented reality smartphone app and viewers also suggests that it may belong to the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. The use of deep learning and the focus on perceptual quality suggests that it may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the paper's emphasis on prescriptive sampling guidelines suggests that it may belong to the geometric topology (cs.GT) sub-category.
